tower.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc
tower.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The bell tower was added to the church in 1848.
tower.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a tall structure, often made of metal, used for signalling, broadcasting etc
tower.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a tall piece of furniture that you use to store things
tower.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to be much taller than the people or things around you
tower.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to be much better than any other person or organization that does the same thing as you
tower.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Mozart towers over all other composers.
